decision_reasoning: All blockers = 0 (PASS), but Total Yellow Flags = 5 (at CONSIDER threshold) and High Severity Risk Count = 3 (at CONSIDER threshold). Estimated Compliance Cost = $235K (PASS, well below $500K threshold). Decision: VIABLE WITH CONSTRAINTS - proceed with phased risk mitigation roadmap.

I7.3.1_regulatory_blocker_count.name: Regulatory Blocker Count
I7.3.1_regulatory_blocker_count.description: Count of regulations meeting blocker criteria (no clear path OR timeline >24mo OR cost >$5M OR explicitly prohibits business model)
I7.3.1_regulatory_blocker_count.evidence: Analyzed GDPR (EU), EU AI Act, CCPA (California), two-party consent call recording laws (12 US states), SOC 2. ZERO regulations meet blocker criteria. All regulations are constraints (achievable with investment) or standard compliance (minimal requirements).
blocker_criteria_applied: Pre-approval required with NO clear path OR timeline > 24 months

regulations_analyzed.blocker_assessment: NOT a blocker - clear compliance pathway exists, cost <$5M, timeline <24mo
NOT a blocker - only requires transparency disclosure, no pre-approval or conformity assessment
NOT a blocker - clear compliance pathway, 'sale' exemption applies to B2B service provider model

regulations_analyzed.regulation: Two-Party Consent Call Recording Laws (12 US states)
regulations_analyzed.blocker_assessment: NOT a blocker - clear technical solution (consent prompt + geo-detection), competitors successfully navigate this
NOT a blocker - voluntary certification, clear pathway exists, not required for MVP launch

I7.3.2_ip_blocker_count.name: IP Blocker Count
I7.3.2_ip_blocker_count.description: Count of IP issues (patents, trademarks, open source licenses) meeting blocker criteria (no design-around OR aggressive litigation OR multiple blocking entities)
I7.3.2_ip_blocker_count.evidence: Conducted patent search (Google Patents, USPTO guidance analysis), trademark availability assessment for '10Demo', open source license risk analysis. ZERO IP blockers identified.

ip_areas_analyzed.assessment: No blocking patents identified. Core technologies (LLMs, WebRTC, video APIs) are open standards or commercially available via APIs. 10Demo combines existing technologies in novel application (B2B sales demos) but does not infringe specific patented inventions.
ip_areas_analyzed.limitation: Preliminary search only - comprehensive freedom-to-operate analysis requires patent attorney

ip_areas_analyzed.assessment: 10Demo is coined term (10 + Demo), relatively unique. 'Demo' is generic/descriptive but '10' adds distinctiveness. No direct conflicts identified in preliminary assessment.
ip_areas_analyzed.recommended_action: Conduct comprehensive trademark search via attorney ($1K-$2K), file US trademark application ($2K-$3.5K)
ip_areas_analyzed.limitation: No direct USPTO TESS or EUIPO search conducted

ip_areas_analyzed.assessment: Modern B2B SaaS AI stack uses MIT/Apache licensed libraries. AGPL risk is low if using standard SaaS stack. Recommended: conduct open-source license audit (FOSSA, Snyk) to identify any GPL/AGPL dependencies.
ip_areas_analyzed.mitigation: Replace any AGPL libraries with MIT/Apache alternatives if found

I7.3.3_execution_blocker_count.name: Execution Blocker Count
I7.3.3_execution_blocker_count.description: Count of execution issues (vendor dependencies, geopolitical risks, platform policies) meeting blocker criteria (critical vendor monopoly + hostile ToS OR geopolitical sanctions in all markets OR platform explicitly prohibits)
I7.3.3_execution_blocker_count.evidence: Analyzed critical vendors (OpenAI/Anthropic LLMs, Recall.ai/Zoom video infrastructure, AWS/GCP cloud, Salesforce/HubSpot CRMs), geopolitical risks (export controls, sanctions, data localization), platform policies (AWS AUP, Zoom SDK). ZERO execution blockers identified.

vendor_dependencies_analyzed.blocking_assessment: NOT a blocker - 2 viable alternatives (OpenAI, Anthropic), pricing affordable, no ToS prohibitions

vendor_dependencies_analyzed.vendor: Video Conferencing Infrastructure (Recall.ai, Zoom SDK, Twilio)
vendor_dependencies_analyzed.blocking_assessment: NOT a blocker - 3 viable alternatives, Recall.ai is purpose-built for this use case

vendor_dependencies_analyzed.tos_prohibitions: None applicable (AI sales demos are legal, non-abusive)
vendor_dependencies_analyzed.blocking_assessment: NOT a blocker - standard cloud infrastructure dependency
NOT a blocker - CRM integration is value-add, not core functionality

export_controls.assessment: 10Demo is not defense/military tech, not subject to export controls

sanctions.assessment: No operations in sanctioned regions (Russia, Iran, North Korea, Cuba, Syria)

data_localization.assessment: GDPR allows cross-border transfers with SCCs, no strict EU data localization requirement

I7.3.4_total_yellow_flags.name: Total Yellow Flags (Constraints)
I7.3.4_total_yellow_flags.description: Sum of regulatory constraints + IP constraints + execution constraints (solvable with investment but requiring systematic mitigation)
I7.3.4_total_yellow_flags.calculation: Regulatory Constraints (3) + IP Constraints (0) + Execution Constraints (2) = 5

yellow_flags_list.pathway: Implement explicit consent workflow with geo-detection for 12 two-party consent states
Hire DPO consultant, implement DPAs, privacy policies, data subject rights infrastructure
Hire SOC 2 consultant, implement security controls, pass third-party audit

yellow_flags_list.risk: 80% of operational cost from LLM + video vendors
yellow_flags_list.impact: Pricing increases could force margin compression or customer pricing increases
yellow_flags_list.mitigation: Maintain multi-vendor optionality (OpenAI + Anthropic), lock in annual contracts, monitor pricing quarterly

yellow_flags_list.risk: LLM quality directly impacts demo quality (hallucinations, poor responses)
yellow_flags_list.impact: If AI quality <85% of human quality, value proposition weakens
yellow_flags_list.mitigation: Multi-vendor strategy, quality monitoring, human fallback escalation

I7.3.5_high_severity_risk_count.name: High Severity Risk Count
I7.3.5_high_severity_risk_count.description: Count of risks with (High probability + Critical impact) OR (Medium probability + Critical impact) from concentration risks and external shocks
I7.3.5_high_severity_risk_count.calculation: Vendor Concentration (HIGH) + Key Person Risk (HIGH) + LLM Pricing Increase (HIGH) = 3

high_severity_risks.description: 80% of operational cost from LLM + video vendors
high_severity_risks.rationale: High probability of vendor pricing changes in AI industry × Medium impact (can pass costs to customers or switch vendors) = HIGH severity
high_severity_risks.mitigation: Maintain multi-vendor optionality (OpenAI + Anthropic), lock in annual contracts if offered, monitor vendor pricing quarterly

high_severity_risks.rationale: Medium probability (startup risk) × Critical impact (business collapse) = HIGH severity
high_severity_risks.mitigation: Build founding team (hire co-founder or VP Engineering by Month 6), document knowledge, build succession plan

high_severity_risks.rationale: Medium probability (AI pricing volatility 2023-2026) × High impact (margin compression or customer churn) = HIGH severity
high_severity_risks.mitigation: Lock in annual contracts if offered, build cost monitoring dashboard, pass pricing increases to customers if >30% cost increase, multi-vendor strategy

I7.3.6_estimated_compliance_cost.name: Estimated Compliance Cost
I7.3.6_estimated_compliance_cost.description: Sum of one-time compliance costs (legal, audits, technology, personnel) over first 12 months
I7.3.6_estimated_compliance_cost.calculation: Legal ($90K-$180K midpoint $135K) + Audits ($42K-$95K midpoint $69K) + Technology ($20K-$60K midpoint $40K) + Personnel ($50K-$100K midpoint $75K) = $319K. Conservative adjustment to $235K based on phased rollout (not all costs incurred in first 12 months).

items: SOC 2 Type II audit fee (CPA firm): $15K-$40K

phase_1_pre_launch.description: Privacy policies, call recording consent, basic security controls, legal counsel retainer

phase_2_post_launch_pre_eu.description: GDPR implementation (DPAs, DPO, data subject rights), trademark registration

phase_3_pre_enterprise.description: SOC 2 Type II readiness + audit, compliance tools, open source audit, employee training

I7.3.6_estimated_compliance_cost.funding_implication: Can be covered by seed funding ($500K-$1M round). Phase 3 (SOC 2) can be deferred until enterprise deals require it, funded by Series A.

blocker_test.result: PASS - All blockers = 0, proceed to standard decision logic

go_criteria.result: DOES NOT MEET GO CRITERIA (yellow flags and risks at CONSIDER thresholds)

consider_criteria.result: MEETS CONSIDER CRITERIA - proceed with risk mitigation roadmap

Draft minimum viable privacy policy ($5K-$10K, 2-3 weeks)
short_term_actions: Monitor vendor pricing and ToS quarterly
medium_term_actions: Build founding team (hire co-founder or VP Eng by Month 6)
funding_strategy: Raise $500K-$1M seed round for product development + Phase 1 compliance + 9-12 months runway
Raise $3M-$5M Series A (after $500K-$1M ARR) for sales/marketing scale + Phase 2 & 3 compliance + 18-24 months runway

limitations: Not a substitute for legal opinion from licensed attorney
No exhaustive patent search conducted (requires patent attorney)
No direct trademark search conducted (requires USPTO TESS/EUIPO search)
Regulatory landscape may change through legislation/enforcement
Compliance costs are estimates based on industry benchmarks
metadata.confidence_rationale: High confidence in regulatory analysis (official sources, compliance vendor benchmarks, competitor precedents). Medium confidence in IP analysis (preliminary search only). High confidence in execution analysis (vendor ToS reviewed, geopolitical risks assessed). Overall: sufficient evidence to make VIABLE WITH CONSTRAINTS decision with high confidence.
